document_metadata.name: Modulatory effects of α7 nAChRs on the immune system and its relevance for CNS disorders

citation.db_name: Modulatory effects of α7 nAChRs on the immune system and its relevance for CNS disorders.
citation.journal: Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS

links.evidence: Peripheral and CNS immune cells strongly express a7 nAChRs; activation of a7 nAChRs on these cells has been shown to suppress inflammatory processes.

citation.journal: Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS

citation.journal: Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS

links.evidence: As outlined above, α7 nAChRs are expressed both on macrophages and microglia, and their activation leads to anti-inflammatory effects.

citation.journal: Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS

citation.db_name: Modulatory effects of α7 nAChRs on the immune system and its relevance for CNS disorders.
citation.journal: Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS

links.evidence: Stimulation of α7 nAChRs attenuates macrophage responsiveness and diminishes release of cytokines [23, 46, 47, 66] and therefore will limit the negative impact of inflammation on tetrahydrobiopterin metabolism.

citation.db_name: Modulatory effects of α7 nAChRs on the immune system and its relevance for CNS disorders.
citation.journal: Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS

links.evidence: Ser133-P-CREB is a substrate for GSK3β, which subsequently results in rapid catabolism of CREB and thus termination of CREB signaling. CREB competes with NFκB for binding to CREB-binding protein (CBP), and therefore limits the inflammatory NFκB signal. Activation of α7 nAChRs in the brain may thus lead to an anti-inflammatory activity.

citation.db_name: Modulatory effects of α7 nAChRs on the immune system and its relevance for CNS disorders.
citation.journal: Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS

links.evidence: Concerning function, activation of a7 nAChRs results in strong calcium and sodium influxes, which in the case of a presynaptic location facilitates neurotransmitter release [17, 18].

citation.journal: Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS

links.evidence: This indicates that in neurons a7 nAChRs have a special role in the modulation of intracellular calcium, enabling substantial calcium entry at resting or hyperpolarized membrane potential, which is different compared to other nAChRs, but similar to NMDA receptors at depolarized membrane potential.

citation.db_name: Modulatory effects of α7 nAChRs on the immune system and its relevance for CNS disorders.
citation.journal: Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS

links.evidence: The intracellular pathways following a7 nAChR activation in non-neuronal cells involve calcium influx through the channel pore, which then triggers calcium-induced calcium release from ryanodine- and IP3-dependent stores [10, 28, 59].

citation.db_name: Modulatory effects of α7 nAChRs on the immune system and its relevance for CNS disorders.
citation.journal: Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS

links.evidence: For instance, activation of a7 nAChRs leads to stimulation of adenylate cyclase-1 and thus to increases in cAMP levels[61]. This in turn stimulates protein kinase A (PKA), which may result in further signaling events such as CREB activation [61] and GSK3 inhibition [62]

links.evidence: One of the intracellular signaling cascades described in this context is a pathway that involves JAK2-mediated tyrosine-phosphorylation of the p85 subunit of PI3 K, activation of Akt and CREB, and subsequent inhibition of (or competition with) NFkappaB [20, 25, 49, 63] (see Fig. 1).

citation.db_name: Modulatory effects of α7 nAChRs on the immune system and its relevance for CNS disorders.
citation.journal: Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS

links.evidence: Alternatively, downstream signaling towards NFkB may involve JAK2 activation of STAT3 [65–68] (see Fig. 1). Finally, activation of a7 nAChRs can result in inhibition of p38 MAP-kinase [8, 10, 19]. A functional consequence of this latter pathway is inhibition of the release of inflammatory mediators like TNFa and HMGB1 [8, 10, 19].

links.evidence: Overall, given the expression pattern, the cellular signaling cascades, and information from vagus nerve stimulation, the data strongly indicate that activation of the a7 nAChR suppresses the responsiveness of the immune system.

citation.journal: Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS

links.evidence: In particular, activation of α7 nAChRs might lead to a shift in microglia phenotype from M1-like (activated for anti-microbial activity) to M2-like (resolution, removal of debris) [10, 11, 13, 83, 120], while a similar process has been described in the periphery.

citation.db_name: Modulatory effects of α7 nAChRs on the immune system and its relevance for CNS disorders.
citation.journal: Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS

links.evidence: Activation of α7 nAChRs in the brain has been shown to activate protein kinase A (PKA) via a mechanism involving calcium-dependent activation of adenylatecyclase-1 and, consequently, an increase in cAMP levels [61].

citation.db_name: Modulatory effects of α7 nAChRs on the immune system and its relevance for CNS disorders.
citation.journal: Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS

links.evidence: It can be speculated that stimulation of nAChRs α7 counteracts microglia activation, such that white and gray matters are exposed less to the toxic microglia products. In this respect it is noteworthy that minocycline, a compound which suppresses microglia activation, also specifically improved negative symptoms (for review see [164]).

citation.db_name: Modulatory effects of α7 nAChRs on the immune system and its relevance for CNS disorders.
citation.journal: Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS

links.evidence: a7 nAChR activation can lead to inhibition of lymphocyte proliferation [28, 201] and to inhibition of macrophage and microglia activation [8, 11, 24, 25, 46].

citation.db_name: Modulatory effects of α7 nAChRs on the immune system and its relevance for CNS disorders.
citation.journal: Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS

links.evidence: Data from preclinical models of Parkinson’s disease indicate that nicotine and selective a7 nAChR agonists reduce microglia activation and neuroinflammation, and prevent nigro-striatal dopamine-neuronal loss [206, 207].

links.evidence: Activation of a7 nAChR expressed on microglia alters the phenotype and promotes phagocytosis and metabolism of Ab [12].
